Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
XLVII. THE OSTELERES. The Assumption and Coronation of the Virgin. Square brackets represent sections of text unclear or absent in the original and supplied by the current editor
[PERSONS OF THE PLAY. Jesus. Maria. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 Angelus.]

[Scene I, The heights of Heaven.] Jesus. Myne aungellis Ã¾at are bright and schene, On my message take ye Ã¾e waye Vnto Marie, my modir clene, Ãat berde is brighter Ã¾an Ã¾e daye. Grete hir wele haly be-dene, An to Ã¾at semely schall ?e saye, Off heuene I haue hir chosen quene, In joie and blisse Ã¾at laste schall aye. I wille ?ou saie what I haue Ã¾oughte, And why Ã¾at ?e schall tille hir wende, I will hir body to me be brought, To beilde in blisse with-outen ende. Mi flesshe of hir in erÃ¾e was tone, Vnkindely thing it were, i-wis Ãat scho schulde bide be hire allone, And I beilde here so high in blis. For-thy tille hir Ã¾an schall ?e fare, Full frendlye for to fecche hir hedir, Ãere is no thyng Ã¾at I loue more, In blisse Ã¾anne schall we belde to-gedir. i Angelus. O! blissfull lorde, nowe moste of myght, We are redye with all oure myght Thy bidding to fulfille, To Ã¾i modir, Ã¾at maiden free, Chosen cheffe of chastite, As it is thy wille. ii Angelus. Off Ã¾is message we are ful fayne, We are redy with myght and mayne, Bothe be day and be nyght; Heuene and erÃ¾e nowe gladde may be, Ãat frely foode nowe for to see, In whome Ã¾at Ã¾ou did light. iii Angelus. Lorde! Jesu Criste, oure gouernoure, We are all boune att Ã¾i bidding, With joie and blisse and grete honnoure, We schall Ã¾i modir to Ã¾e bringe.

[Scene II, Near Mary's grave.] iv Angelus. Hayle! Ã¾e doughtir of blissid Anne, Ãe whiche consayued thurgh Ã¾e holy goste, And Ã¾ou brought forthe both god and manne, The whiche felled doune Ã¾e fendis boste. v Angelus. Haile! roote of risse, Ã¾at fourthe brought Ãat blissid floure oure saueoure, The whiche Ã¾at made mankynde of noght, And brought hym vppe in to his toure. vi Angelus. Of Ã¾e allone he wolde be borne In-to Ã¾is worlde of wrecchidnesse, To saue mankynde Ã¾at was for-lorne, And bringe Ã¾ame oute of grete distresse. i Angelus. Ãou may be gladde, bothe day and nyght, To se thy sone oure saueoure, He will Ã¾e croune nowe, lady bright, Ãou blissid modir and faire floure. ii Angelus. Marie modir, and mayden clene, Chosen cheffe vn-to Ã¾i childe, Of heuene and erÃ¾e Ã¾ou arte quene, Come vppe nowe, lady, meke and mylde. iii Angelus. Ãi sone has sente vs aftir Ã¾e To bringe Ã¾e nowe vnto his blisse, Ãer schall Ã¾ou belde and blithe be, Of joie and mirthe schall Ã¾ou no?t misse. iv Angelus. For in his blisse with-outen ende, Ãere schall Ã¾ou alkynne solas see, Ãi liffe in likyng for to lende, With Ã¾i dere sone in Trinite. Maria [rising]. A! blissid be god, Fadir all weldand, Hym selffe wottith best what is to doo, I thanke hym with harte and hande, Ãat Ã¾us his blisse wolde take me too: And ?ou also his aungellis bright, Ãat fro my sone to me is sente, I am redy with all my myght, For to fulfille his comaundement. v Angelus. Go we nowe, Ã¾ou worÃ¾i wight, Vnto Ã¾i sone Ã¾at is so gente, We schall Ã¾e bringe in-to his sight, To croune Ã¾e quene, Ã¾us hase he mente. vi Angelus. Alle heuene and erÃ¾e schall worschippe Ã¾e, And baynnely be at Ã¾i biddinge, Thy joie schall euere incressid be, Of solas sere Ã¾an schall Ã¾ou synge. Cantando

[Scene III, The heights of Heaven.] i Angelus. Jesu, lorde and heuene-is kyng, Here is Ã¾i modir Ã¾ou aftir sente, We haue her brought at Ã¾i biddynge, Take hir to Ã¾e as Ã¾ou haste mente. Maria. Jesu, my sone, loved motte Ã¾ou be, I thanke Ã¾e hartely in my Ã¾ought Ãat Ã¾is wise ordandis for me, And to Ã¾is blisse Ã¾ou haste me broght. Jesus. Haile! be Ã¾ou Marie, maiden bright, Ãou arte my modir and I thy sone, With grace and goodnesse arte Ã¾ou dight, With me in blisse ay schall Ã¾ou wonne. Nowe schall Ã¾ou haue Ã¾at I Ã¾e hight, Thy tyme is paste of all Ã¾i care, Wirschippe schall Ã¾e aungellis bright, Of newe schall Ã¾ou witte neuere more. Maria. Jesu my sone, loued motte Ã¾ou be, I thanke Ã¾e hartely in my Ã¾o?t, Ãat on Ã¾is wise ordandis for me, And to this blisse Ã¾ou has me broght. Jesus. Come forth with me, my modir bright, In-to my blisse we schall assende, To wonne in welthe, Ã¾ou worÃ¾i wight, That neuere more schall it haue ende. Thi newis, modir, to neuen Ã¾ame nowe, Are turned to joie, and soth it is, All aungellis bright Ã¾ei schall Ã¾e bowe, And worschippe Ã¾e worÃ¾ely i-wis. For mekill joie, modir, had Ã¾ou, Whan Gabriell grette Ã¾e wele be Ã¾is, And tolde Ã¾e tristely for to trowe, Ãou schulde consayue Ã¾e kyng of blisse. i Angelus. Nowe maiden meke and modir myne, Itt was full mekill myrÃ¾e to Ã¾e, Ãat I schulde ligge in wombe of Ã¾ine, Thurgh gretyng of an aungell free. ii Angelus. The secounde joie modir was syne, With-outen payne whan Ã¾ou bare me. iii Angelus. The thirde aftir my bittir peyne, Fro dede on lyve Ã¾ou sawe me be. iv Angelus. The fourthe was when I stied vppe right, To heuene vnto my fadir dere, My modir, when Ã¾ou saugh Ã¾at sight, To Ã¾e it was a solas seere. v Angelus. Ãis is Ã¾e fifte, Ã¾ou worthy wight, Of Ã¾e jois Ã¾is has no pere, Nowe schall Ã¾ou belde in blisse so bright, For euer and ay, I highte Ã¾e here. vi Angelus. For Ã¾ou arte cheffe of chastite, Off all women Ã¾ou beris Ã¾e floure, Nowe schalle Ã¾ou, lady, belde with me, In blisse Ã¾at schall euere in-dowre. i Angelus. Full high on highte in mageste, With all worshippe and all honnoures, Wher we schall euere samen be, Beldand in oure bigly boures. ii Ang. Alle kynnys swetnesse is Ã¾er-in, Ãat manne vppon may thynke, or wiffe, With joie and blisse Ã¾at neuere schall blynne, Ãer schall Ã¾ou, lady, lede thy liffe. iii Angelus. Ãou schalte be worshipped with honnoure In heuene blisse Ã¾at is so bright, With martiris and with confessouris, With all virginis, Ã¾at worthy wight. [Jesus.] Be-fore all oÃ¾ere creatours I schall Ã¾e giffe both grace and might, In heuene and erÃ¾e to sende socoure, To all Ã¾at seruis Ã¾e day and nyght. I graunte Ã¾ame grace with all my myght, Thurgh askyng of Ã¾i praier, Ãat to Ã¾e call be day or nyght, In what disease so Ã¾at Ã¾ei are. Ãou arte my liffe and my lekyng, Mi modir and my mayden schene, [Placing the crown on Mary's head. Ressayue Ã¾is croune, my dere darlyng, Ãer I am kyng, Ã¾ou schalte be quene. Myne aungellis bright, a songe ?e singe, In Ã¾e honnoure of my modir dere, And here I giffe ?ou my blissing, Haly nowe, all in fere.
